Doc_Ser3 module

Doc_Ser3.connect_to_db()[source]

Establishes a connection to the SQLite database.

Returns:

A connection object to the database.

Return type:

sqlite3.Connection

Doc_Ser3.create_purchase_history_table()[source]

Creates the ‘purchase_history’ table in the database if it does not exist.

Prints a success message if the table is created, or an error message if the table creation fails.

Doc_Ser3.display_available_goods()[source]

Retrieves a list of available goods from the goods service.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries containing information about available goods.

Return type:

list

Doc_Ser3.get_full_purchase_history()[source]

Retrieves the full purchase history from the purchase history table.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries containing information about each purchase.

Return type:

list

Doc_Ser3.get_good_details(good_name)[source]

Retrieves details of a specific good by its name from the goods service.

Parameters:

good_name (str) – The name of the good.

Returns:

A dictionary containing information about the specified good.

Return type:

dict

Doc_Ser3.get_user_purchase_history(customer_username)[source]

Retrieves the purchase history of a specific user from the purchase history table.

Parameters:

customer_username (str) – The username of the customer.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries containing information about each purchase of the user.

Return type:

list

Doc_Ser3.make_sale(good_name, customer_username)[source]

Processes a sale, deducting money from the customer’s wallet, updating the goods count, and saving the purchase history.

Parameters:

  • good_name (str) – The name of the good to be purchased.

  • customer_username (str) – The username of the customer making the purchase.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a status message or an error message if the sale process fails.

Return type:

dict

Doc_Ser3.save_purchase_history(purchase_history)[source]

Saves the purchase history to the purchase history table.

Parameters:

purchase_history (dict) – A dictionary containing information about the purchase.
